author: Lionel Ray Green
title: 'The Martian' scores stellar opening weekend; 'Pan' opens nationwide Friday
text:
Play The Martian Trailer 2 - Mark Watney is stranded on Mars after his crew departs the planet, thinking he's dead. He plans his survival as he rations food and builds a green house with his knowledge and expertise as a botanist. on.aol.com Sci-fi adventure drama “ The Martian ” nearly broke the October record for an opening weekend and animated sequel “ Hotel Transylvania 2 ” enjoyed a solid second weekend, according to according to industry estimates reported Sunday by movie tracking site Box Office Mojo . Based on the best-selling novel and directed by Ridley Scott, “The Martian,” starring Matt Damon, grossed $55 million in ticket sales from Friday to Sunday, That total is a shade shy of the record $55.7 million debut of “Gravity,” which opened on the same weekend in 2013. Final figures are expected Monday, so “The Martian” could still break the record.
Critics and audiences loved “The Martian.” A stellar 94 percent of reviews were positive and 94 percent of moviegoers liked “The Martian,” according to movie review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes , which wrote the film is “smart, thrilling, and surprisingly funny” and “offers a faithful adaptation of the best-selling book that brings out the best in leading man Matt Damon and director Ridley Scott.”
After one weekend at No. 1, “Hotel Transylvania 2,” featuring the voice of Adam Sandler as Dracula, slipped one notch to No. 2 in its second weekend, grossing $33 million for a total of $90.5 million since opening Sept. 25. R-rated crime drama “ Sicario ,” starring Emily Blunt, Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin, expanded nationwide and finished No. 3 with $12 million for a total of $15 million since opening in limited release Sept. 18.
Comedy “The Intern,” starring Robert De Niro and Anne Hathaway, dropped two spots to No. 4 in its second weekend, grossing $11.6 million for a total of $36.5 million since opening Sept. 25. Action sci-fi sequel “Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials” also fell two spots to No. 5 in its third weekend, grossing $7.6 million for a total of $63.2 million since opening Sept. 18.
Biographical adventure drama “ The Walk ,” starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, opened exclusively in IMAX theaters last week and will open nationwide in all formats on Friday, Oct. 9. Based on the true story of a high-wire artist attempting to walk between the World Trade Center towers, “The Walk” grossed $1.5 million over the weekend for a total of $1.9 million since opening Wednesday.
Critics and audiences are enjoying “The Walk” so far. An excellent 86 percent of reviews were positive and 85 percent of moviegoers liked “The Walk,” according to Rotten Tomatoes, which wrote the film “attempts a tricky balancing act between thrilling visuals and fact-based drama and like its wire-walking protagonist, pulls it off with impressive élan.”
In addition to the nationwide release of “The Walk” on Friday, Oct. 9, family fantasy adventure “ Pan ” also opens. The film chronicles the origin and adventures of the orphan who will become Peter Pan. Only 45 percent of early reviews were positive for “Pan,” according to Rotten Tomatoes, which wrote the film “finds a few bursts of magic in its prequel treatment of classic characters, though not enough to offset the rushed plot and shrill, CGI-fueled action.”
